content:
Diagnosis
	1. Bilateral breast adenocarcinoma with miliary metastatic disease
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not appropriate due to extent of disease

	Chemotherapy
	1. Jan-Mar 2024: Weekly Paclitaxel with Trastuzumab
	2. Mar-Apr 2024: Trastuzumab-Deruxtecan (T-DXd)

	Clinical studies
	NGS panel identified HER2 G776delinsVC mutation

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with deteriorating clinical status

	Current issues
	1. Progressive dyspnoea requiring oxygen therapy
	2. Increasing fatigue and reduced mobility
	3. Poor oral intake

	Summary of consultation

I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with her daughter. Unfortunately, her condition has significantly deteriorated over the past two weeks. The miliary metastatic disease in her lungs has progressed despite two cycles of T-DXd, with increasing oxygen requirements now at 4L/min at rest. Her mobility has declined significantly, and she now requires assistance with most activities of daily living. Her appetite remains poor despite antiemetics and steroids.

CT chest performed yesterday shows progression of diffuse miliary metastases throughout both lung fields with new small pleural effusions bilaterally. There is also progression of liver metastases with largest lesion now measuring 4.8cm (previously 3.2cm).

On examination today, she appears notably more fatigued with respiratory rate of 24/min. Oxygen saturations 92% on 4L/min. There are widespread fine crackles throughout both lung fields. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3.

	Further investigations
	None currently appropriate

	Medication prescribed
	1. Dexamethasone 4mg bd
	2. Oxycodone MR 10mg bd
	3. Metoclopramide 10mg tds

	Follow up
	1. Urgent referral to palliative care team - completed today
	2. Community nursing team referral - completed today
	3. Oncology review in 1 week or sooner if needed

	Required GP actions
	1. Please prescribe oxygen concentrator for home use
	2. Consider increased package of care
	3. Please monitor for need for breakthrough medications

	Summary of information given to patient
	Detailed discussion held regarding disease progression and changing focus of care to symptom management. [redacted name] and family understand that prognosis is now limited to weeks.

primary_cancer.metastases: miliary lung metastases, liver metastases, bilateral pleural effusions

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows progression of diffuse miliary lung metastases, new bilateral pleural effusions, progression of liver metastases with largest lesion 4.8cm (previously 3.2cm)
Significant clinical deterioration with increasing oxygen requirements to 4L/min

patient_facts.value: Poor appetite despite antiemetics and steroids
Respiratory rate 24/min, oxygen saturations 92% on 4L/min, widespread fine crackles both lung fields
Requires assistance with most activities of daily living

status_updates.value: Bilateral breast cancer with miliary metastases. Progressive disease despite two lines of HER2-directed therapy with significant clinical deterioration
Disease progression on T-DXd after two cycles with worsening lung and liver metastases
Significant deterioration in performance status to ECOG 3 with increasing oxygen requirements
Transition to palliative care focus with cessation of systemic anti-cancer therapy
Urgent palliative care and community nursing referrals completed, oncology review in 1 week
